definitions.definition: A quantity of a liquid; more than a splash.
definitions.example: We added a slosh of white wine to the sauce.

definitions.definition: (of a liquid) To shift chaotically; to splash noisily.
definitions.example: The water in his bottle sloshed back and forth as he ran.

definitions.definition: (of a liquid) To cause to slosh
definitions.example: The boy sloshed water over the edge of the bath.
They were so completely soaked that they sloshed when he walked.

definitions.definition: (of a liquid) To pour noisily, sloppily or in large amounts
definitions.example: He really sloshed on the sauce- they were a bit strong for my taste.

definitions.definition: To move noisily through water or other liquid.
definitions.example: The streets were flooded, but they still managed to slosh their way to school.
